'''Spirit Family Reunion''' is a band from [[Brooklyn]], New York influenced by traditional American music such as country, folk and gospel. Founded in 2009 by core members Nick Panken (vocals, acoustic guitar), Maggie Carson (five string banjo, vocal), and Stephen Weinheimer (washboard, bass drum, tambourine, vocals), and featuring a rotating cast of musicians such as Ken Woodward (bass, vocals), Or Zubalsky (drums), Noah Block-Harley (fiddle, vocals), Dylan Block-Harley (drums, vocals), [[Twain (musician)|Mat Davidson]] (fiddle, accordion, mandolin, vocals), and Pete Pezzimenti (drums, vocals).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blog.cleveland.com/minkinsmusic/2015/06/put_your_hands_together_for_sp.html|title=Put Your Hands Together for Spirit Family Reunion|work=cleveland.com}}</ref> They have referred to their style as "homegrown American music" and "open-door gospel", and are often compared to [[Bluegrass music|bluegrass]], [[Country music|country]] and [[Appalachian music|appalachian]] music.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Greene|first1=David|title=Spirit Family Reunion: Music For Church Basements|url=https://www.npr.org/2012/07/29/157532251/spirit-family-reunion-music-for-church-basements|website=NPR Music|publisher=NPR Music|accessdate=August 9, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Minkin|first1=Jay|title=Put Your Hands Together for Spirit Family Reunion|url=http://nodepression.com/live-review/put-your-hands-together-spirit-family-reunion|website=No Depression|accessdate=November 11, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Horowitz|first1=Hal|title=Spirit Family Reunion: Hands Together|url=http://americansongwriter.com/2015/04/spirit-family-reunion-hands-together/|website=American Songwriter|accessdate=November 11, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Jackson|first1=Michael|title=Brooklyn â€˜buskers' Spirit Family Reunion are Bangor-bound|url=http://www.irishnews.com/arts/2016/08/12/news/brooklyn-buskers-spirit-family-reunion-are-bangor-bound-647745/|website=The Irish Times|accessdate=November 11, 2018}}</ref>

== History ==

The band started out as Panken and Weinheimer playing with different people each night at the bar where they worked, and eventually became Spirit Family Reunion.<ref name=":0">{{cite web|url=http://www.abeerwiththeband.com/spirit-family-reunion/?rq=spirit%20family%20reunion|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170428051136/http://www.abeerwiththeband.com/spirit-family-reunion/?rq=spirit%20family%20reunion|url-status=dead|archive-date=April 28, 2017|title=A Beer With Spirit Family Reunion|website=A Beer With the Band|publisher=A Beer With the Band|last1=Mitchell|first1=Kristen|accessdate=August 9, 2015}}</ref> Officially formed in 2010, Spirit Family Reunion has self-produced and self-released two full-length albums, ''No Separation'' (2013) and ''Hands Together'' (2015).<ref>{{cite web|title=About|url=http://www.spiritfamilyreunion.com/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160321121429/http://www.spiritfamilyreunion.com/|url-status=dead|archive-date=March 21, 2016|website=Spirit Family Reunion|accessdate=August 10, 2015}}</ref> They have toured with bands such as [[Trampled by Turtles]], [[Levon Helm]], [[Tedeschi Trucks Band]], [[Dr. Dog]], [[The Felice Brothers]], and [[Alabama Shakes]] and performed at the [[Newport Folk Festival]], [[Hardly Strictly Bluegrass]], [[Celebrate Brooklyn!]], [[FloydFest]], [[Bristol Rhythm & Roots Reunion]], [[Flood City Music Festival]], [[Buckle Up Music Festival|The Buckle Up Music Festival]], [[Shakori Hills Grassroots Festival]], and the [[Americana Music Festival & Conference]] among others.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Leahey|first1=Andrew|title=Hear Spirit Family Reunion Sing Away Blues With 'It Does Not Bother Me'|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/premieres/hear-spirit-family-reunion-sing-away-blues-with-it-does-not-bother-me-20150129|website=Rolling Stone Country|accessdate=August 10, 2015}}</ref> They played a [[Tiny Desk Concerts|Tiny Desk Concert]] in 2012 and took part in the [[Bob Dylan in the 80s: Volume One|''Bob Dylan in the 80s'' project]]. They were also featured in [[The Deli Magazine|issue No. 34 of ''The Deli Magazine'']] in 2013.
